intro: Galium campylotrichum, commonly known as the curly-stemmed bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its stems are often covered in fine, wiry hairs, giving it a distinctive, curly appearance. Galium campylotrichum produces small white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer.
